attributes.action: Warfighting And Peacekeeping - Time to create a Humanitarian Support Force.
attributes.additional_details: Create a Corps of Peace-keepers composed of a battalions of the following; infantry, military police, engineering, logistics, and medics, each composed of five companies allowing deployment in sync with army harmony guidelines. From the Humanitarian Emergency Response Review: “We﻿ need﻿ to﻿ place ﻿the﻿ creation﻿ of ﻿resilience﻿ at﻿ the﻿ heart﻿ of ﻿our﻿ approach ﻿both﻿ to﻿ longer-term﻿ development﻿ and﻿ to﻿ emergency﻿ response. ﻿This﻿ will ﻿require﻿ DFID ﻿to﻿ make﻿ humanitarian﻿ response﻿ a﻿part﻿ of﻿ its﻿ core﻿ development﻿ work. We﻿ need﻿ to﻿ defend﻿ and﻿ strengthen﻿ the﻿ humanitarian space. ﻿This﻿ refers ﻿to ﻿the﻿ need﻿ for ﻿humanitarian﻿ workers ﻿to﻿ be﻿ granted﻿ access﻿ and﻿ protection﻿ as﻿ they﻿ seek ﻿to ﻿provide﻿ humanitarian﻿ assistance." We must make use of ex-servicemen who come with a wealth of skills and experience in working within conflict zones. The DfID budget is to grow to £8B per year just as Defence is expected to shrink to £32B per year, this is cost effective.
